version: osx 1.6.0-beta8
When I use command atom in command line, it occurs error message below:

The application /Applications/Atom.app cannot be opened because its executable is missing.
How can I fix it ?

data.title: Atom crashes on OS X after 4 key presses when using it for interactive git rebase
data.body:
### Description

I am using `atom --wait` as editor for git. But when trying to do an interactive rebase the editor crashes after input or delete 4 letters (number of letters inputted can vary depending on cursor position). I can navigate fine with the arrow keys, so it's not keypresses that trigger this but rather modifying the displayed text.

Copy / Cut works fine, but pasting causes the crash. Sometimes I can paste 1 time and the crash happens, sometimes I can go up to 3 times. The number of times I can paste something stays consistent when I paste the same thing at the same position.

Tried rebasing another repository, I had to copy paste a line Â±10 times to reproduce
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Set atom as git editor
2. Do an interactive rebase 
3. Type a couple of things
4. Watch atom crash

**Expected behavior:** Nothing, I would expect the text to be entered normally and no crash

**Actual behavior:**  Crash
### Versions

```
$ atom --version
1.5.4

$ apm --version
apm  1.6.0
npm  2.13.3
node 0.10.40
python 2.7.10
git 2.5.4
```

OS X El Capitan v10.11.3

data.title: Deleting project folder causes path to change to the directory one level above
data.body:
Hi all,

I'm trying to fix a bug related to issue #10212 on how atom handles project paths.
### Description

 If you delete a folder that is open as a project and then close and reopen atom, the project path changes to the directory one level above the deleted folder instead of just removing the project path altogether.
### Steps to reproduce

1) Create a folder in your desktop, populate it with some random files.
2) In atom, select the option to add the project folder to the workspace.
3) Manually delete the project from your desktop.
4) If you close and reopen atom, the project folder will be gone, but in its place atom will include the directory one level above it (in this case, the Desktop).

In my mind, deleting the folder you were working on should not make atom choose to open another directory in its place, which could cause all sorts of problems if you unintentionally modify it. I'm hoping to change it so that when a folder gets deleted, all links to the folder and its files will be removed from the workspace.
### Versions

1.6.0-dev atom
apm  1.6.0
npm  2.13.3
node 0.10.40
python 2.7.6
git 1.9.1

data.title: Fix node env
data.body:
https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/11054 wasn't preserving the `NODE_PATH` environment variable when the `process.env` was changed. This caused at least one problem: fuzzy-finder could no longer index files. This fix preserves all `NODE_` environment variables from the original environment, no matter what other changes are made.

/cc @joefitzgerald @nathansobo

data.title: Snippets...
data.body:
You guys are making Snippet key commands too difficult and much too slow to reference. I have to go Preferences > wait for the packages to load > find the package > Settings.... JUST TO SEE THE AVAILABLE COMMANDS. And... that's just for ONE set of Snippets.

Bad user experience...

My suggestion:
(1) Snippets should be separated from other package installs in the same way that Themes are seperated.

(2) Additionally, and most importantly, snippets should be able to be launched into their own separate window and/or a separate pane that is separate from the IDE window. A Snippets browser.

(3) There should be a pull-down menu a the top of the window that is populated with all of the names of the snippet packages in alphabetical order. I should be able to quickly toggle between each package and view its snippets.

Thank you!

data.title: Line height is too large by default
data.body:
_Using Atom 1.5.4 in win10 x64. Having 1920x1200 resolution in my monitor._

When opening any file in Atom, it shows only 49 lines at any time.
I feel that the current line height is too much.

_For reference:_

```
Sublime Text 3: 71 lines 
 Notepad++ 6.9: 65 lines
      gVim 7.4: 66 lines 
  UltraEdit 23: 67 lines
```

By default Atom has in its settings:
`Line Height` as 1.5 _(as a multiplier of font size)_ and 
`Font Size` as 14

If I set the former to **1.2** (and the latter to **13**),
then the visible lines area becomes on par with the other editors: 69 lines.

So, my suggestion is to change these settings default values to 1.2 (and 13) respectively.

data.title: The Atom Env Path on Windows constantly breaks after updates.
data.body:
I'm currently on Atom 1.5.4. I've checked the atom.cmd file and it's pointing to the correct folder, and the path is pointing to `C:\Users\LukeWatts85\AppData\Local\atom\bin`

However, opening from cmd using "atom" no longer works. Instead it says "Cannot find path to specified file".

The "Open with Atom Editor" in the right-click menu also no longer works.

apm no longer runs.

This has happened numerous times before also. There must be a better way to update Atom than creating versioned folders and removing the old ones.

Other info:
Atom v 1.5.4
Windows 8.1

data.title: All views (pane?) and tabs are not really visible (very small width)
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](https://atom.io/docs/latest/hacking-atom-debugging#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](https://atom.io/docs/latest/hacking-atom-debugging#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](https://atom.io/docs/latest/hacking-atom-debugging)?
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?

For more information on how to write a good [bug report](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-bug-report) or [enhancement request](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-enhancement-suggestion), see the `CONTRIBUTING` guide.
### Description

Currently, I have one project (folder) that open views with a very limited width, see screenshots below (taken in SAFE MODE).
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Open [my setup repo](https://github.com/MoOx/setup) (not sure if that's related to some local cache). **Note that this only happen in this folder** (from what I see), didn't find any other yet).
2. Open a new document (cmd+n) or about or settings page

**Expected behavior:** Normal (full) view width, with correct tab visibility

**Actual behavior:** View/tabs are not visible as they used to be

_Screenshots taken in safe mode_

![screen shot 2016-03-13 at 06 34 51](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/157534/13727146/fff9d3da-e8e6-11e5-8e4e-088105cffdf5.png)
![screen shot 2016-03-13 at 06 35 00](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/157534/13727148/0002249a-e8e7-11e5-9b6a-9253f1e60c00.png)
![screen shot 2016-03-13 at 06 35 12](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/157534/13727147/fffd3ec6-e8e6-11e5-8082-72c0951ce0c3.png)

Here is a detailed view. I don't see anything that might take some space here

![screen shot 2016-03-13 at 06 47 01](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/157534/13727163/7aeae02a-e8e7-11e5-931a-b29ef82121f3.png)

Is there a way I can find some local cache about the opened folder to see if that can fix the issue?
**I previously installed nuclide**, so maybe that is related ?
This bug did not happened when I installed nuclide, but some days after, after I changed some nuclide  config. I disabled nuclide and a lot of plugin, reverted my atom config (from the one versionned in setup repo) and still have the issue in safe mode.
### Versions

â¯ atom --version
1.5.4

â¯ apm --version
apm  1.6.0
npm  2.13.3
node 0.10.40
python 2.7.10
git 2.7.2

data.title: Something broke Atom
data.body:
I was working with Atom and then I noticed a keyboard shortcut wasn't working. I thought maybe it was a glitch so I closed Atom and when I opened it again the main window wouldn't open. The OSX system menu only had the Atom menu and so no file, edit, view, or any of the other menus.

I closed Atom again, and reopened it. Nothing.

I tried opening Atom using Terminal, nothing.

I tried `atom --safe`, nothing.

Deleted the .atom/storage folder, reopened Atom. Nothing.

Deleted the whole .atom folder, reopened Atom, still Nothing.

I deleted the Atom.app, downloaded it again and now it works, although I have to reconfigure everything again.

Here is an error from Console.app, I'm afraid this is the best I can give you.


data.title: :arrow_up: electron v0.37.0
data.body: Update electron to the latest upstream. Supersedes PR #10983.

data.title: Having issues on a QWERTY Spanish Keyboard
data.body:
### Description

I can't type colons (:) or closing brackets (]) when using a QWERTY Spanish Keyboard.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Just use a QWERTY Spanish Keyboard

**Expected behavior:**
When I type the symbol shown in my keyboard, I expect it to apper in the text editor

**Actual behavior:**
When I try to type a colon (:) a greater than (>) symbol appears instead.
When I try to type a closing bracket (]) nothing happens.
### Versions

1.5.4

data.title: packagesWithKeymapsDisabled option is not visible and not persisting
data.body:
Atom versoin: `1.5.4`

Problem:

I know there exists a `packagesWithKeymapsDisabled` (Packages with keymaps disabled) setting.
But I don't see it in the atom's `Settings` screen. It should be under **Core Settings** sections, but it's not there.

If I open `config.cson`, there is no `packagesWithKeymapsDisabled` property there, but:
1. If I add this line to the `config.cson` under the `core` key:
   
   ``` coffee
   packagesWithKeymapsDisabled: []
   ```
2. Reload atom. The option appears in `Settings` and works. But, after the reload, the line disappears from the `config.cson` file.
3. After the next reload of atom the option is no loner in the `Settings` screen. The problem persists.

data.title: Remove Tooltips and Animations!
data.body:
Hi,

Is there a way to remove all the tooltips and animations?
- Blue tooltip showing under the tabs
- Animation of the tab close button
- Define a working set plus button
- Tooltip over strings etc.
  Maybe an option in the settings to turn off all the animations would be helpful.

Thank You!

data.title: Cursor disappearing when using arrow keys or clicking
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [ y] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](https://atom.io/docs/latest/hacking-atom-debugging#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
- [ y] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](https://atom.io/docs/latest/hacking-atom-debugging#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [ y] Did you check the [debugging guide](https://atom.io/docs/latest/hacking-atom-debugging)?
- [ y] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [ y] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [ y] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?

For more information on how to write a good [bug report](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-bug-report) or [enhancement request](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-enhancement-suggestion), see the `CONTRIBUTING` guide.
### Description

The cursor tends to stop blinking over certain portions of my code. 
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Open Atom
2. Move cursor through code using arrow keys, cursor disappears
3. Move cursor around code using mouse, cursor disappears

[screencap of issue](http://g.recordit.co/pkiVPd6eJw.gif)

**Expected behavior:** Cursor blinks throughout code without gaps. 

**Actual behavior:** Cursor disappears over different gaps through the code.
### Versions

1.5.4

data.title: npm install on windows fails on nodegit
data.body:
We're trying to start again contribution on atom core issue #5901 , but we're not able to `npm install` successfully, and then not even to run `apm test`. Build instead completes fine.

Environment:
- Win 10 x64
- node 4.3.2
- npm 3.8.0
- git 2.7.2.windows.1
- Python 2.7.10
- GYP_MSVS_VERSION=2013
- PYTHON=C:\Python27\python.exe
- local atom root path: `D:\atom`

Also tried setting `ATOM_ELECTRON_URL=http://gh-contractor-zcbenz.s3.amazonaws.com/atom-shell/dist`, with no apparent effect. We tried several times, with no luck. I think that we started with a little deeper root path and failure happened on another module. Then we moved to current top level directory.

`npm install` output log ends with:

```
[nodegit] Everything is ready to go, attempting compilation
[ 'rebuild' ]
gyp WARN install got an error, rolling back install
gyp ERR! configure error
gyp ERR! stack Error: 403 response downloading https://atom.io/download/atom-shell/v4.3.2/node-v4.3.2-headers.tar.gz
gyp ERR! stack     at Request.<anonymous> (D:\atom\node_modules\nodegit\node_modules\node-gyp\lib\install.js:244:14)
gyp ERR! stack     at emitOne (events.js:82:20)
gyp ERR! stack     at Request.emit (events.js:169:7)
gyp ERR! stack     at Request.onRequestResponse (D:\atom\node_modules\nodegit\node_modules\request\request.js:951:10)
gyp ERR! stack     at emitOne (events.js:77:13)
gyp ERR! stack     at ClientRequest.emit (events.js:169:7)
gyp ERR! stack     at HTTPParser.parserOnIncomingClient (_http_client.js:412:21)
gyp ERR! stack     at HTTPParser.parserOnHeadersComplete (_http_common.js:88:23)
gyp ERR! stack     at Socket.socketOnData (_http_client.js:302:20)
gyp ERR! stack     at emitOne (events.js:77:13)
gyp ERR! System Windows_NT 10.0.10586
gyp ERR! command "C:\\Program Files\\nodejs\\node.exe" "D:\\atom\\node_modules\\nodegit\\node_modules\\node-gyp\\bin\\node-gyp.js" "rebuild"
gyp ERR! cwd D:\atom\node_modules\nodegit
gyp ERR! node -v v4.3.2
gyp ERR! node-gyp -v v3.0.3
gyp ERR! not ok
1
npm ERR! Windows_NT 10.0.10586
npm ERR! argv "C:\\Program Files\\nodejs\\node.exe" "C:\\Program Files\\nodejs\\node_modules\\npm\\bin\\npm-cli.js" "install"
npm ERR! node v4.3.2
npm ERR! npm  v3.8.0
npm ERR! code ELIFECYCLE

npm ERR! nodegit@0.11.6 install: `node lifecycleScripts/install`
npm ERR! Exit status 13
npm ERR!
npm ERR! Failed at the nodegit@0.11.6 install script 'node lifecycleScripts/install'.
npm ERR! Make sure you have the latest version of node.js and npm installed.
npm ERR! If you do, this is most likely a problem with the nodegit package,
npm ERR! not with npm itself.
npm ERR! Tell the author that this fails on your system:

npm ERR! You can get information on how to open an issue for this project with:
npm ERR!     npm bugs nodegit
npm ERR! Or if that isn't available, you can get their info via:

npm ERR! There is likely additional logging output above.

npm ERR! Please include the following file with any support request:
npm ERR!     D:\atom\npm-debug.log
```

data.title: Atom Crashes on Windows 10 (Every Time)
data.body:
![atom-error](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5718820/13702476/dcbf04f0-e786-11e5-9917-a351d9aafedd.jpg)
In the last week or so Atom has stopped working on my Windows 10 machine. I use the same packages/extensions as on my mac machine and that's working fine, so I don't think it's a package problem.

The Editor loads but appears blank. Once I resize the window the black editor screen appears along with the tabs of opened files from my last session/project. But nothing responds.
### Prerequisites
- [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](https://atom.io/docs/latest/hacking-atom-debugging#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)
  Yes it happens in Safe Mode. Here's the output:

[http://resource-centre.net/files/atom-error.jpg](http://resource-centre.net/files/atom-error.jpg)
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](https://atom.io/docs/latest/hacking-atom-debugging#update-to-the-latest-version)?
  Yes.
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](https://atom.io/docs/latest/hacking-atom-debugging)?
  I can't load any of the config screens, but the menus appear.
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
  I think so.
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?
  Yes, different people have different causes/solutions.

For more information on how to write a good [bug report](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-bug-report) or [enhancement request](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-enhancement-suggestion), see the `CONTRIBUTING` guide.
### Description

[Description of the bug or feature]
### Steps to Reproduce
1. [First Step]
   Load Atom in Windows. 10
2. [Second Step]
   Nope that's it!
3. [and so on...]

**Expected behavior:** [What you expected to happen]
The last project opens and I can get on with work.

**Actual behavior:** [What actually happened]
The screen is blank until I resize it, then the tabs/editor appears but nothing's clickable and no menus work. They appear but clicking a menu item does nothing.
### Versions

1.5.4
You can get this information from executing `atom --version` and `apm --version` at the command line.

data.title: Selection.onDidChangeRange callbacks do not get an event passed
data.body: According to [the docs](https://atom.io/docs/api/v1.5.4/Selection#instance-onDidChangeRange), a callback should get an `event` as argument. However, [Atom doesn't do this](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/v1.5.4/src/selection.coffee#L784).

data.title: Focusing Atom will show a progress cursor
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](https://atom.io/docs/latest/hacking-atom-debugging#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
- [ ] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](https://atom.io/docs/latest/hacking-atom-debugging#update-to-the-latest-version)? 1.5.3
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](https://atom.io/docs/latest/hacking-atom-debugging)?
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?
### Description

When focusing the Atom window a progress cursor appears (even if there is no visible action running).
![screen](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8310677/13701283/3913594a-e787-11e5-8fea-5c3fe4067f27.gif)
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Focus Atom
2. Focus another window
3. Focus Atom again

**Expected behavior:** No progress icon

**Actual behavior:** Progress icon
### Versions

Atom: 1.5.3
Windows: 7

data.title: Cant keep tabs
data.body:
Atom is the best text editor everything is good, But the only reason that make me to avoid using Atom is that its not possible to keep tabs. Wen you worked on several files at different directory you need to switch context, But its happened with lose all of the tabs and you can keep the tabs wen you close and re-open Atom. even some times you create a pans without saving because you want use it as a note or .. but you again lost this tab. and at notepad++ I don't have this problem because I can keep all of my tabs even if I not saved them. If its possible please add this features to Atom to keep tabs.

Thank you
### Versions

1.5.4

data.title: gulp watch task will crash by atom, but ok with sublime text.
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](https://atom.io/docs/latest/hacking-atom-debugging#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
  Yes, start atom with $ `atom --safe`
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](https://atom.io/docs/latest/hacking-atom-debugging#update-to-the-latest-version)?
  Yes, 1.5.4
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](https://atom.io/docs/latest/hacking-atom-debugging)?
  Yes, both of `(no links)`
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
  Yes, by keyword `gulp ENOENT`
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
  I think, Yes. I removed everything that in `~/.atom/packages` and quit application and re-start atom.
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?
  Yes, https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/8610#issuecomment-194997415

For more information on how to write a good [bug report](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-bug-report) or [enhancement request](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-enhancement-suggestion), see the `CONTRIBUTING` guide.
### Description

Run gulp default task, and open js file, hold cmd+s, crash with <kbd>atom</kbd>, but ok with <kbd>sublime text</kbd>.

demo: https://github.com/Pleasurazy/atom-issue-gulp-crash
### Steps to Reproduce
1. run gulp watch
2. open js file with atom
3. hold <kbd>cmd+s</kbd> with atom

**Expected behavior:**

``` sh
[12:06:52] Finished 'compile' after 3.38 ms
[12:06:52] Starting 'compile'...
[log] through /Users/pleasurazy/git/atom-issue-gulp-crash/app/assets/pages/welcome/index.js
[log] event finish sent
[12:06:52] Finished 'compile' after 3.37 ms
[12:06:52] Starting 'compile'...
[log] through /Users/pleasurazy/git/atom-issue-gulp-crash/app/assets/pages/welcome/index.js
[log] event finish sent
etc..
```

**Actual behavior:**

crash randomly..

``` sh
 pleasurazy@retina î° ~/git/atom-issue-gulp-crash î° î  master î° gulp
[12:07:51] Using gulpfile ~/git/atom-issue-gulp-crash/gulpfile.js
[12:06:52] Finished 'compile' after 3.37 ms
[12:06:52] Starting 'compile'...
....a while
[12:07:51] Starting 'default'...
[12:07:51] Finished 'default' after 8.86 ms
events.js:141
      throw er; // Unhandled 'error' event
      ^

Error: ENOENT: no such file or directory, stat '/Users/pleasurazy/git/atom-issue-gulp-crash/app/assets/pages/welcome/index.js~'
    at Error (native)
```
### Versions

atom 1.5.4
gulp 3.9.1
mac os x 10.11.3
npm 3.8.1
node 4.2.6

data.title: Atom not Loading up, I get these errors, can't use at all.
data.body: ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3184381/13690869/e548ad54-e6e8-11e5-87b7-9471e0c32123.png)

data.title: Bump markdown-preview@v0.158.0
data.body:
This PR adds [Use GitHub style when "Save as HTML"](https://github.com/atom/markdown-preview/pull/335), but CI failed. Due to the "language-javascript-was-updated-but-markdown-preview-didn't-receive-the-changes-yet" failures, see https://github.com/atom/markdown-preview/pull/335#issuecomment-195120014.

Not sure if this will cause a build error in atom/atom too, hence this PR.
